International Partner Universities                       Application Process for NYU Students                                                                   NYU International Exchange Program      Current NYU Students   In addition to the academic centers abroad, NYU students have the opportunity to be considered to study away from New York at one of the University’s partner institutions by participating in a student exchange. The International Exchange Program enables select NYU students to study at a variety of institutions – all distinguished research universities – while earning NYU credit and being immersed in the culture of some of the world's most exciting cities.   Many universities offer course work in English and others require advanced knowledge of a foreign language.   Students who are approved to enroll in the NYU exchange pay NYU tuition which allows you to maintain your financial aid package, including grants and scholarships (unique partner fees may be required). You may also apply for additional financial aid (in the form of loans) for study abroad through the NYU Office of Financial Aid.   Follow the links above to review the list of Partner Universities and to learn about the highly selective Application Process. For additional information regarding the University-wide International Exchange Program, please contact us at:   New York University  Global Programs Office  University Hall  110 East 14th Street, Lower Level  New York, NY 10003  phone: (212)998-4433  fax: (212)995-4103  email: global.outgoing.exchanges@nyu.edu      Students Currently Enrolled at one of the Exchange Partner Universities   You must contact the office at your university that manages the nomination process for the program to learn how your school selects nominees. Typically it is the International Office, Office of International Affairs, or International Exchange Office who can assist you.   Read more about the exchange program at NYU in the information flyer .   If you have additional questions, email: international.exchange@nyu.edu            Students Enrolled at Universities that are not partners with NYU   If you are enrolled at a University that is not a partner with NYU you cannot participate in the exchange program. There are opportunities for you to enroll at NYU for courses through the University's Special Sessions programs. These programs allow you to enroll as a visiting student, take courses with NYU students, and receive an official NYU transcript for the transfer of credit back to your university.       Spring in New York -- undergraduate level courses   Summer in Greenwich Village -- undergraduate and graduate level courses   Winter Session -- undergraduate and graduate level courses     If you have questions about these options please direct your inquiry to the contact information provided on each web site. to New York    Information from Student Affairs    Resources for International Students    Part-Time Enrollment Request Form for International Students             Meet our Current Students from:    China    Thailand    Saudi Arabia    Meet our Alumni from:    Israel    Chile    Malaysia    Taiwan                         Name: Daniela Wachholtz    Where is home? Santiago, Chile    Status in NYU OT program? Alumni from the MA and DPS programs    What was your educational/professional background in occupational therapy before coming to NYU? Professional program in occupational therapy from Universidad de Chile    What are your research interest(s)? Pediatrics, Self regulation in Preschool children    Where you involved in any research projects during your studies, if so what were they? Yes, I worked as a research assistant in the department of Applied Psychology in the Tools of the Mind research.    Why did choose to attend New York University’s OT program ? Because of the Professors and the attractive program they offered at the time of application.    What did you enjoy most about your experience at NYU? The possibility to share classes with other disciplines, I liked the environment of NYU and the student resources they offered.    What was your favorite thing to do in New York City? Walking around different neighborhoods and discover the city culinary variety and lifestyles.    Where are you currently working? In Chile at Universidad de Los Andes and in a pediatric private practice                     This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©       by New York University. All rights reserved.
